Package com.flag4j

Interface VectorOperationsMixin<T,​U,​V,​W,​Y,​X extends Number,​TT,​UU,​VV,​WW>

Type Parameters:
T - Vector type.
U - Dense Vector type.
V - Sparse Vector type.
W - Complex Vector type.
Y - Real Vector type.
X - Vector entry type.
TT - Matrix type equivalent.
UU - Dense Matrix type equivalent.
VV - Sparse Matrix type equivalent.
WW - Complex Matrix type equivalent.
All Superinterfaces:
TensorOperationsMixin<T,​U,​V,​W,​Y,​X>
interface VectorOperationsMixin<T,​U,​V,​W,​Y,​X extends Number,​TT,​UU,​VV,​WW> extends TensorOperationsMixin<T,​U,​V,​W,​Y,​X>
This interface specifies operations which should be implemented by any vector.

  • Method Details

    • stack

      TT stack​(Vector b)
      Stacks two vectors along columns. Note, unlike the stack method for matrices, the orientation of the vectors IS taken into account (see return section for details).
      Parameters:
      b - Vector to stack to the bottom of this vector.
      Returns:
      The result of stacking this vector and vector b.
      - If both vectors are column vectors, then a matrix with 2 columns will be returned.
      - If both vectors are row vectors, then a matrix with 2 rows will be returned.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException -
      - If the number of entries in this vector is different from the number of entries in the vector b.
      - If the vectors are not both row vectors or both column vectors.

    • stack

      VV stack​(SparseVector b)
      Stacks two vectors along columns. Note, unlike the stack method for matrices, the orientation of the vectors IS taken into account (see return section for details).
      Parameters:
      b - Vector to stack to the bottom of this vector.
      Returns:
      The result of stacking this vector and vector b.
      - If both vectors are column vectors, then a matrix with 2 columns will be returned.
      - If both vectors are row vectors, then a matrix with 2 rows will be returned.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException -
      - If the number of entries in this vector is different from the number of entries in the vector b.

    • innerProduct

      X innerProduct​(Vector b)
      Computes the inner product between two vectors.
      Parameters:
      b - Second vector in the inner product.
      Returns:
      The inner product between this vector and the vector b.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If this vector and vector b do not have the same number of entries.

    • cross

      U cross​(Vector b)
      Computes the vector cross product between two vectors.
      Parameters:
      b - Second vector in the cross product.
      Returns:
      The result of the vector cross product between this vector and b.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If either this vector or b do not have 3 entries.

    • toMatrix

      UU toMatrix()
      Converts a vector to an equivalent matrix.
      Returns:
      A matrix equivalent to this vector. This method will respect the orientation of the vector. That is, if this vector is a row vector, then the resulting matrix will have a single row. If this vector is a column vector, then the resulting matrix will have a single column.
